Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 08:58PM kim11 wrote: tory - wow...i envy your conviction.  i can't believe you opted for a mx 4 days after diagnosis - was that even the recommendation?  my saga is far more convoluted - and kind of pathetic... my dx was 7/30 last year and i went for the lumpectomy but margins weren't clean - my doctor then said definitely BMX but i switched jobs and doctors - and have had 3 re-excisions because of dcis.  my last path report was cleared for me to do radiation but there was still dcis in 2 of the 3 samples. but all my current doctors are saying radiation and watching is fine... but i do want to be done with this.  it's so odd i can't just flip that switch to put it into proper perspective - that's all it takes, i know...  and it's funny because my breasts don't at all define me - they never have - and i don't even think i have much erogenous sensation, oddly....  it's just that i finally started to become active and well, you become attached to your body, such as it is...  my brother called it sentimentality and maybe that's it...  but having never even pierced my ears, i just can't embrace this change somehow.  and it's all this new research coming out about markers to determine dcis likelihood of becoming invasive - and there being an inverse relationship between aggression of invasive tumor and presence of dcis that makes me think i can just hang on for a few more years and if it comes back, deal with it then...  ok.  now i'm rambling and will stop.  i'm going to get to that place of acceptance.  i have almost two weeks.  and i need to go in that day feeling good about my choice... although i hate even seeing myself write some of these things that make me appear so vain and self-absorbed.  i know my situation is about as good as it can possibly be with this disease.  i am extraordinarily lucky and, in my rational moments, am aware of that.  and my heart goes out to everyone who doesn't even have the luxury of a choice. but i am revealing my darker side here...  but yeah - as for the age factor - one of the few perks in this ordeal has been hearing how "young" i am.  it's a little funny...
